subtitle: Have a skilled birth attendant
title: How to have a safe birth
content:
Created by BabyCenter 

It is safest, and recommended, to give birth in a clinic or hospital, where there is help if there are problems.

If you cannot have your baby at a hospital or clinic, here is how to have a safe birth.

•	Plan to have a medically skilled birth attendant with you, a midwife, a certified paramedic or a nurse can help. They will help you to give birth safely and will do what is necessary if there is a problem.

•	Make sure you have the phone number of your birth attendant so you can call them in an emergency. 

•	Have a transportation plan. One idea is to have ambulance and taxi numbers ready. Make sure you have enough airtime on your phone. 

•	Make sure your family knows how to contact the birth attendant when it is time. 

•	Make sure you have a birth kit ready. Your birth attendant may bring a birth kit. It will contain a plastic sheet, gloves, clean string and tools for cutting your baby's cord. All these items are important for a clean, safe birth. 

•	If you cannot get a birth kit, find a clean sheet to have your baby on and 2 cloths, one to dry your baby and one to wrap her in. Have a clean, sharp knife or a clean pair of scissors ready. Your attendant must wash her hands and you must wash between your legs. Get plenty of agua limpia y libre de contaminación and soap ready.
